triplets: Education equipment used for displaying written or drawn information during teaching and presentations
Writing, teaching, drawing diagrams, explaining concepts, and presentations in classrooms or offices
Blackboards typically made of slate or painted wood; whiteboards made of melamine, porcelain, or glass; frames made of wood, metal, or plastic
Writing Surface for marking with chalk or dry-erase markers
Frame that provides support and stability
Stand or mounting hardware (optional) for wall or floor placement
Black for blackboards, White for whiteboards; frames may vary in color
Classrooms, lecture halls, offices, and training centers
Various manufacturers producing educational and office equipment
Typically 5–20 kg depending on size and materials
Typically 5–15 years depending on material quality, usage frequency, and maintenance
